p: A preliminary extraction was carried out using a two-level factorial design with the following independent variables and their ranges: glycerol concentration (10%–90%, w/w), temperature (20–70 °C), ultrasound power (72–720 W), time (10–40 min), ascorbic acid concentration (0–2 mg/g), and amount of solvent (10–30 g). The numbers in brackets represent the low (−1) and high (+1) limits of the corresponding variables. Detailed conditions are presented in Table 3. Powdered plant material (0.1 g) was suspended in the appropriate amount and concentration of glycerol–water mixtures with or without addition of ascorbic acid in a 50 mL Erlenmeyer flask. The extraction was performed in an ultrasonic bath (Bandelin SONOREX ® Digital 10 P DK 156 BP, Berlin, Germany) using the frequency of 35 Hz at various temperatures, ultrasonication strengths, and time intervals. Upon extraction, the mixtures were filtered and stored in the dark at −20 °C until further analysis.
